alert.note: Alert for New Castle (Delaware) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 07 at 8:08PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern New Castle, eastern Berks, central Lehigh, northwestern Montgomery, west central Bucks, Chester and southwestern Delaware Counties through 845 PM EDT... At 808 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Kutztown to near Cedarville to West Grove. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Allentown, Wilmington, West Chester, Pottstown, Phoenixville, Coatesville, Emmaus, Westtown, Downingtown, Kennett Square, Birdsboro, Collegeville, Kutztown, Royersford, Fleetwood, Trappe, East Greenville, West Grove, Topton and Schwenksville. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 302 and 325. Northeast Extension between mile markers 38 and 61. Interstate 95 in Delaware between mile markers 15 and 17. Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 38 and 61. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for eastern and southeastern Pennsylvania.
